intro: Disterigma chocoanum, commonly known as the Chocó disterigma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
